meanings.definition: An image or photograph that uses dots of varying sizes to create the illusion of shades of gray.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper included a halftone of the city skyline to show the different shades of gray.
meanings.sent2: The magazine article had a halftone image of a flower to demonstrate the technique.
meanings.sent3: I tried to draw a halftone of my cat, but it ended up looking like a polka-dot disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the beach was like a halftone, with each dot representing a different moment frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The artist's halftone of the forest was so detailed, it almost looked like a black-and-white photograph.

meanings.definition: A printing technique that uses dots of varying sizes to reproduce continuous tone images.
meanings.sent1: The textbook explained how a halftone is used in printing to create detailed images.
meanings.sent2: The poster for the concert used a halftone to print the musician's portrait.
meanings.sent3: The printer mistakenly used a halftone for the recipe book, making the food photos look pixelated.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night seemed like a halftone, each dot representing a different building shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The comic book artist's halftone of the superhero was so vibrant, it seemed to jump off the page.
